intro: Myopordon hyrcanum, commonly known as the Hyrcanian myopordon, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Myopordon hyrcanum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting biodiversity in its native range.
